conclusion: The car labeled 'A' starts from an initial position and moves towards a cluster of blocks.
When the car collides with other objects, the physics principle of deflection and power transfer comes into play.
Deflection refers to objects bouncing off each other upon impact, and power transfer refers to energy being transferred from one object to another during a collision.
In the second image, the car labeled 'A' has already come into contact with the red block, indicating a collision.
